result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final status/scheduling conference on December 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on December 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.

[ma] Case called at 3:03 PM 
Defendant Alexander Ian Siniard appeared via zoom from Fox Lake Correctional, in custody.  Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court for Alexander Ian Siniard.  DA Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty Rumpf requests a trial be scheduled. 

Scheduling is discussed.
recess: 3:05pm 
NEXT: (1)FSSC on 12/6/22 at 3:30pm (2)Jury Trial on 12/12/22 at 8:15am

Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 9:06am
Defendant Alexander Ian Siniard appears by videoconferencing from the Fox Lake Correctional Institution, in custody. Attorney Amber Rumpf appears in court. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds the video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Rumpf indicates that she has not been able to scheduled a phone call with Mr. Siniard, but intends to do so.  She requests the scheduling of a pretrial conference; the Defense is awaiting a plea offer from the State.  
recess 9:10am 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on July 13th at 3:4opm, (2) Status Conference on July 26th at 3:00pm
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on February 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 10:30am [All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Alexander Ian Siniard appears from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr. Siniard waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 10:37am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/23/22 at 9:00am   (2) Status Conference on 4/14/22 at 10:00am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Att Rumpf
Preliminary hearing on February 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
--no operation of a motor vehicle

[ma] Case called at 1:30pm[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Alexander Ian Siniard  appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. Rumpf alerts the Court that Count #2 is charged as a forfeiture violation; Atty Flint indicates that it was intended to be a criminal OAR, will be corrected when Information is filed

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct, but will remain in custody on hold. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit at the request of Defense 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $5000 CASH Bond with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
--no operation of a motor vehicle 

recess 1:42  pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 2/4/22 at 10:30am
